detaileddescription.para: Constant used as a value for Custom Key value

Used in the switch case in evEncryptReq when determining type of Key used for encryption. Represents Custom Key value.
values 0u
Constant used as a value for FFB-SKC

Used in the switch case in evEncryptReq when determining type of Key used for encryption. Represents FFB-SKC value.
values 1u
Constant used as a value for RSAD-SKC

Used in the switch case in evEncryptReq when determining type of Key used for encryption. Represents RSAD-SKC value.
values 2u
Constant used as a value in RSAD Signature and Encryption check

Used as initial value for: numCalcChallengeStatus numCalcSignatureStatus numCheckRSASignatureStatus numCheckSignatureStatus numrawEncryptStatus Used when checking signatures and encryption in: evCalcChallengeReq evCalcSignatureReq evCheckRSADSignatureReq
values 1u
Constant used as intial value for ZKA Signature Status

Used as initial value for ZKA Signature Status in CheckSignature_ZKA
values 3u
Constant describing size of a buffer for CsH Encryption

Determines length of array CSH_ENCRYPTION_BUFFER_SIZE Used in evEncryptReq and evCalcSignatureReq
values 16u
Constant describes marker direction size

Used in : evCalcSignatureReq evCheckSignatureReq CheckSignature_ZKA
values 1u
Constant describes refreshness buffer size for CsH

Used in : evCalcSignatureReq evCheckSignatureReq CheckSignature_ZKA
values 8u
Constant used as size of input vector

Determines length of u8CalcSignatureReqBuffer and u8CheckSignatureReqBuffer Is used in evCalcSignatureReq when clearing buffer for signature calculations.
values 128u
Constant describing size of buffer for a key

Used in : evEncryptReq evCalcSignatureReq CheckSignature_ZKA During Key extraction from Csmpi
values 16u
Constant describing length of Csmpi result

Used in getRandomNumber and evCalcChallengeReq when
values 3u
Constant describing maximum length of payload for signature

Used in evCheckSignatureReq when checking the signature
values 33u
Constant describing maximum length signature

Used in evCheckRSADSignatureReq when checking the RSAD signature
values 6u
Constant describing minimal length of payload for signature

Used in evCheckRSADSignatureReq and evCheckSignatureReq when checking the signature
values 4u

Event function of the CsH module. The function provides the response to Kessy for Challenge Generation request.

This function is called by KessyEventMngr to minimize the overhead on reaction for the function call. CryptoHandler shall report the result of challenge generation to the calling application on the client-server interface by triggering Rte_Call_CsH_KYBCM_Ev_StCryptoKY_evCalcChallengeResp.
reentrant No context Rte layer thread safe Yes multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core asynchronous
Function is called by Kessy SWC
N/A
void
void
Globals
rawChallengeResult - Buffer used for a raw Challenge generation numCalcChallengeStatus - Status of a raw Challenge generation
Input->Output-Correlation
Result of challenge generation gets provided via RTE to Kessy SWC
Call Sequence

SWATT unit test TEST_CsH_Call_Ev_StCryptoKY_evCalcChallengeResp

Event function of the CsH module. The function provides the response to Kessy for Checking the RSAD Signature request.
